item.title: Report E-2024050178
item.description:
Report E-2024050178

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: CONLEY
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 24, 2024, at 0858 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Conley, Georgia regarding the release of a total of 2 gallons of Muriatic Acid (UN1789, 8, II) from (15) 1-gallon poly jugs. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was caused by the cargo being improperly loaded and was contained to a small area of the trailer floor, a 15ft x 3ft area of the concrete dock, multiple areas of asphalt and it also impacted a tire. Contractors were able to neutralize the release then clean the release with absorbents, and the proper PPE. All waste generated was placed in (3) 55-gallon DFâ€™s and was staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050137
item.description:
Report E-2024050137

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: NEWNAN
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NNW experienced a UN1824 Gardobond Additive H 7212 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of product released to a 15' x 15' area of the concrete dock floor, a 1' x 1' area of the concrete lot below the bay, and a 1' x 10' area of the trailer floor due to a puncture caused by the trailer wall. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. Absorbents and absorbent powder were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into a 95-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
